boardgame.name: Floating Stepping Stones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 536th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a number of floating stepping stones crossinge a gorge.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Abandoned Obelisk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 535th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features an almost finished but abandoned obelisk in the desert.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: The Ice Flower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 534th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features an ice flower like structure blooming on the snow covered ground in a forest.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: 50 Modern Suburb Residents 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different residents and homes that are perfect for a modern suburbia (notably United States) environment. Included in each entry are the following: Name of home owner(s), total number of occupants (presented as Oc#: #), style of home (craftsman, neo-classical, cape cod, etc.), number of bedrooms and bathrooms, and a brief descriptive of either the yard or interior of home (rose bushes, air hockey table, etc.). Perfect for quickly fleshing out modern neighborhoods from crime/drama settings, super hero settings, early zombie outbreak, early apocalypse, etc.

boardgame.name: Planetary Settlement Map 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you have a small space age planetary settlement in your game but no map to go with it? Perfect! Because we have the map for you!

This map collection focuses on a small space age colony with 38 different building locations total. The designer has provided 3 versions of the map- unnumbered, numbered locations, and gridded off (each square equals 15 feet). There's also a blank map key page as well as one filled in with suggested location types.

boardgame.name: Village Map 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you have a village on your campaign world and you already have a name for it, you already know what sort of folks inhabit it, and you have some ideas on how to work it into the adventure... but you need a map. This product serves that need.

This drop in village map features the following: a basic version of the map without numbers, a numbered version of the village map, a gridded off version of the basic map to show space (each square is equal to 10 feet), a blank map key page that allows you to enter the types of village locations, and another version of the map key in which the map designer has entered in their own suggestions in case you need some ideas on how to populate the village.

boardgame.name: Ruins Rivervalley Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twin wooden drawbridges—somehow still intact amidst the crumbling ruins—span a beautiful blue river that slowly meanders its way past rotting buildings and fallen stones, oblivious to the rise and fall of mankind.
Cracked crates and barrels, their timber spongy to the touch, lay abandoned. Cobweb filled stairwells lead down into more ruins, deep beneath the earth. What were once wine cellars are empty, the shelves within broken with age. Sections of the docks have crumbled, making it all too easy to slip and fall into the river below.

The river rises and floods the ruins occasionally, giving them a musty smell and coating the old stone with slick moisture.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Belford's Crossing
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two wooden drawbridges—somehow still intact amidst the crumbling ruins—span the deep chasm below. Beneath many layers of cliffs and fog winds a river surrounded by scrub, while higher up the remains of a multi-story tavern is filled with only crumbling stones and rotting floorboards.

Cracked crates and barrels, their timber spongy to the touch, lay abandoned. Cobweb filled stairwells lead down into more ruins, deep beneath the earth. What were once wine cellars are empty, the shelves within broken with age. Walls leading to the cliff have crumbled, allowing the fierce winds to howl throughout the remnants of this underground settlement.

boardgame.name: Cliffton Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A village clings to sheer cliffs, far beneath which winds a river surrounded by scrub and thick fog. Two wooden drawbridges span the deep chasm, separating the town into North and South Cliffton.

Shops and tall buildings rise above smaller living quarters and alleyways in this many-storied city.

The air is fresh here and you can hear the cries of birds echoing through the canyon below. Many of them nest in the cliffs, and sometimes local children scale down them in search of the eggs, or chicks to sell in the market.

Adventure Idea

You find a middle-aged man lying on a forest road, clasping his bloody hands over a stab wound in his gut. Lying next to him is the cold body of a golden retriever—you can see the blood where she dragged herself from where she was injured, so she could be close to him when she died.

Left for dead after a brutal robbery by bandits, the man begs you to hunt them down and kill the robbers for what they did. He had been on his way to sell a family heirloom to buy medicine for his mother. Not only did they kill his Lola, they stole his hope of healing his mother as well.

When they left, he heard a woman with fiery red hair and a red-wolfskin cape tell the group that their next stop was the Flying Fish tavern for drinks. She was the one who the bandits gave the heirloom to.

Arriving at the tavern, you hear loud howling coming from two tables of heavily armed teenagers. They are joking about a man and his bitch who was stupid enough to not pay for their protection… But the woman the man described isn’t there.

WHAT’S HAPPENING? The leader of the bandits is a low-level fire mage, who instills the young men with the confidence they need to commit their crimes. She is seductive and charming. In her honor, her followers call themselves the Red Wolves.

While her minions are off getting drunk in the tavern, she is selling the heirloom to an antiquarian on the other side of Belford’s Crossing. If you interrogate the men in the tavern they’ll put up a fight but eventually tell you where she is. If you kill them, you’ll need to ask the other witnesses.

boardgame.name: Rivervalley Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twin wooden drawbridges span a beautiful blue river as it slowly meanders through this forested valley. Two towers overlook the area, while a welcoming inn presents weary travelers with swept floors, a warm hearth and hot food from the tavern beneath.

The rest of the village is located beneath the ground, too—only just above the river, which rarely swells above the dock. Stone alleyways wind away from the tavern towards small, warmly-lit shops and homes. Wildflowers grace the walkways closer to the water’s edge and a couple of mechanical rooms house giant wheels which raise or lower the drawbridges.

boardgame.name: Whiskey Role Playing
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Whiskey Role Playing is a role-playing game-system, and not intended to be used as a real life simulation, although some of the mechanics do attempt to capture as much realism as possible. Much of the game mechanics are scaled for tabletop adventures and do not always scale perfectly with real life situations, or scenarios.

Whiskey Role Playing game system is designed to be used for any campaign setting or genera`, including but not limited to: Fantasy (magical or mundane), Sci-Fi, Post-Apocalyptic, Space Opera, and Supers.

boardgame.name: Echoes
boardgame.description:
Echoes is a game about atonement or damnation. A game about fear and the obscure and resilience in the face of adversity both physically and mentally. You will explore the suppressed and repressed aspects of your mind and either project them into your new reality or deny them by projecting them into others.

You are a lone soul lost in a mysterious town searching for what remains of a loved one who has long since gone beyond the world. Mysterious creatures roam the mists surrounding the city, turning it into a cage, and supernatural forces rule over the streets and alleys. The echoes of your past latch onto you and challenge you at every turn.

You are alone.

You are afraid.

You are without hope.

Maybe if you survive, you'll learn something about your true self.


Echoes is a solo journaling game where you write or record your story, using only a six-sided die and a deck of cards which provide prompts to get your mind engaged. You may get attacked during the night, recall memories from you and your loved one's past, or answer deep questions about your own morality. Echoes is deadly--but you can also add a block tower to make the deadly even deadlier.


Disclaimer: There are themes of death, gore, violence, loss of agency and mental degradation that some players may find disturbing. Discretion is advised. Themes are heavily influenced in horror genres such as Silent Hill and Resident Evil.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Return of the Jammy Hexer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a system agnostic, one page hexflower adventure on a Spelljammer-esque ship
...
Simply roll 2D6, add the results, and follow the direction

boardgame.name: Fertile Ground
boardgame.description:
Fertile Ground is found all over the world, and as a Gardener, you endeavor to find and Sow the unique flora of the globe in your own Garden. As your Garden grows, your plants help and guide you along this path, accelerating your progress while also necessitating thoughtful orientation of new plants in your Garden. But you're not alone; other Gardeners are watching, and working just as hard to create the most productive Garden by the end of Winter - and only one will prevail!

Gardeners begin with a hand of between 1-7 of the 200 unique Plant Cards and work to Sow these into their Garden. As they do so, they will need to Collect resources (Soil, Sun, Water, Seed) to pay for the cards as well as make sure that they have appropriate space where each plant can survive. Taking turns, Gardeners collect resources, gather cards, and Sow plants into their Gardens; as they accumulate more plants and their associated abilities, their capacity to do each of these increases drastically. The game proceeds through the four seasons (rounds) in which each Gardener has a set number of turns, and at the end of each season Gardeners Pollinate their plants to gather Harvest. At the end of Winter, the value of the accumulated plants, resources, various tokens, and more determine the total value of each Garden, and thus the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Menagerie of Count Zapharry
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The party has been hired as caravan guards by Bob Hogcollar “The Pet King”. He is a wealthy merchant, and owner of “Hogcollar’s Luxury Pet Supply”. While making their way through a mountain pass, the caravan is caught in an avalanche. caused by the sinister Count Zapharry, who seeks retribution against Bob Hogcollar.

A 4-hour tier 2 Dungeoncraft (AL) adventure for 5-10 level characters. Part of the Dungeoncraft Plague of Ancients campaign for Adventures League, Season 10. Based on the “This Seems Familiar” Adventure Seed. Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL of 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Losing Your Mind
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mind is a terrible thing to waste. But when you lose your mind it can be even worse. The party investigates a gnome who entered into the party's camp repeating the same thing over and over again. What can do this to a person?

This is a tier 1 adventure for the Plague Of Ancients Adventure League attuned for APL 2 with about two hours of fun. Uses adventure seed The Muttering Gnome.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Altar Quest: Call of the Lunarin
boardgame.description:
Call of the Lunarin is an Expansion to Altar Quest designed with the collaboration of Isaac Childres from Gloomhaven. It adds an additional playable hero : Leyson Pines, with its associated hero upgrade cards for campaign play. It also adds werewolves, packmasters and Moon children miniatures along with a deck of 60 new cards including threat cards and lurker cards.
This expansion was included in Altar Quest Stretch goals box from the associated Kickstarter campaign.

This Expansion contains :

2 Heroes miniatures (1 human form + 1 werewolf form)
5 Werewolves miniatures
5 Moon Children miniatures
5 Packmasters miniatures
60 cards deck (including Hero deck, Hero upgrade cards, Threat Deck, Lurker cards)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Altar Quest

boardgame.name: Darklight: Memento Mori Dark Master Kit
boardgame.description: With this set you can add more corridors, rooms, furniture and doors to your dungeons. You will get every cardboard component (3 mm thick) that comes with the Core Set.

boardgame.name: Clank! In! Space!: The Last Starkiller
boardgame.description: Clank! In! Space!: The Last Starkiller is a promotional card you can use with the Pulsarcade expansion, with this all-purpose card giving you either 3 credits or a 1-token arcade cabinet when you acquire it.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Clank! In! Space! Adventures: Pulsarcade
Clank! In! Space!: A Deck-Building Adventure

listing.notes: Brand new promo for Clank in Space. Untracked shipping included. If tracked shipping is desired, add $2. PayPal or Venmo payment expected within 3 days of purchase. Thanks!

New, mint copy of "The Last Starkiller" promotional card in English for Clank! In! Space!.
Price includes free Priority Mail shipping.
Unused card.

boardgame.name: btw - puzzle maze
boardgame.description:
User Summary

btw is a puzzle game played on a grid with an entrance, an exit black dots, white dots and color switching tiles.

The goal is to draw a path on the grid from the entrance to the exit, covering all tiles with dots. The trick is the path you draw must be of the color matching the dot's. So you need to use the special tiles to change the color of your path (from black to white or from white to black).

The game contains 88 levels.

boardgame.name: Pandemic: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Pandemic and the On the Brink, In the Lab and State of Emergency expansions.

The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play.

The trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 30.6 x 22.4 x 4.4 cm.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pandemic: Fall of Rome – Folded Space Insert
Pandemic: Iberia – Folded Space Insert
Pandemic: Rising Tide – Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Pandemic: Iberia, or separately compatible with Pandemic: Rising Tide or Pandemic: Fall of Rome. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. The trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

All component types are split by type and there is space for the cards to be sleeved.

The two token trays with raised bases can be used either right way up or upside down depending on the tokens in the game.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 30.6 x 22.2 x 4.3 cm.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer: Pandemic Stand Alone Titles Insert Publisher: Folded Space

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Lost Ruins of Arnak.
The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play.
Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.
The insert includes trays for storing and organising all of the game components.

There is space for all cards to be sleeved with quality sleeves.

The trays include one large cross-piece tray which fills one part of the box, holding the trays around it in place.
This tray might be replaced with an FS-LRA+ insert in the future if there is an expansion released for the game.

Many of the trays can be used during game play and setup.
The small resource trays can be taken from the box and placed directly onto the supply board. Other trays can be arranged aorund the board as needed.

Packing the box is simple: first place the player boards, scorepad and large markers on top of the cross-piece tray. Next place the supply board on the left hand side in the recess provided. Lastly place the main game board and rule book on top. This fully fills the box and allows for vertical storage of the game.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 37.0 x 25.7 x 7.5 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Soothsayer's Runes Promo Card

boardgame.name: Obliquity: The Trenches
boardgame.description:
War is imminent. You and your opponent will battle head-to-head, trying to fashion the strongest trench, using secrecy and special cards to bolster your line. Will you try to strike first and declare war? Or will tensions reach the point of no return...

Obliquity: The Trenches is a quick print and play card game that sees players building up their trench, using merely two decks in the middle. The variety and possibilities in this game meant hat no two trenches will ever be the same. Cards will provide Power Points, which is the ultimate decider of who wins in the game, and is provided by infantry cards and bolstered by support cards. Special cards can provide great advantages, if the trench can support their particular placement rules.

Part face-off and part-puzzle, all the cards have their own placement peculiarities, which will need to be thought about. Players will need to decide which place, out of the available places, would the card be best, to facilitate future potential card draws. This is ultimately the crux of the game, the construction of the trench through quick and simple puzzle-solving.

The cards themselves are more prototypes than anything, as the developer created them using PowerPoint and Google images, but they still retain a thematic and appropriate look to them to make the game enjoyable. Overall, it is a fun, quick and strategic card game that has many more expansions in the pipe-line, if 22 different types of cards wasn't enough.

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Kings of Kung Fu
boardgame.description:
Fans of Kung Fu cinema rejoice! Kings of Kung Fu was developed mainly for fans of classic Kung Fu flicks and designed to be playable by gamers from casual to mid-core so that anyone can pick it up and have fun.

Players are challenged by a mysterious fighter called Red Ronin to take on the role of one of 14 martial arts stuntmen and compete in a one-on-one tournament to prove their worth to win a starring role in the studio's next big film.

Each fighter’s style is inspired by actual moves used in martial arts cinema where their bodies are their weapons. Fine-tuned in diverse and unique methods of physical destruction, each style brings with it 100’s of attacks, counter attacks, blocks and grapples ranging from your basic kicks and punches to advanced attacks and combo chains to devastate their opponents.

Selectable fighters include Tao Lung the Chinese Boxing Master, Chen Fu the master of Drunken Style, Ron Jones and his fierce Shorun-ryu Karate, Hou Feng with his wild and deadly Monkey Style, Lo Wei the Shaolin Master, John Deux is top of his game in Kickboxing, Ju Mao a champion of Hapkido and the Muay Thai Master Chang Tai. Not to mention The White Stallion master of Shotokan Karate, Lo Chi the grappling brawler, master of both Karate and Ninjitsu Ken Suguri, and Yuen Wong with his mix of Wing Chun and various Kung Fu styles. Also tossing their hats into the tournament for a chance at stardom are two new stuntmen: Jane Fury and Shen Wu.


14 character roster - plus 1 boss character



15 unique and dynamic background stages inspired by classic films



100+ unique moves per fighter (including advanced moves and throws)



Soundtrack contains over 20 songs influenced by classic Kung Fu films and old-school style hip hop



Fight against the computer in Arcade Mode, match skills against a friend in Local Multiplayer Matches or master your moves in Practice Mode


https://store.steampowered.com/app/316930/Kings_of_Kung_Fu/

boardgame.name: Now You See
boardgame.description:
Story
Seeking shelter from a thunderstorm, the house you've entered is not the sanctuary you'd hoped for. Uncover horrible secrets within and use your wits and the items you find to escape this immersive blood soaked nightmare...

Features

Original Score by Isserley
Classic Point & Click adventure, played in first-person perspective.
Grisly hand painted 2D art.
Disturbingly voiced characters.
Fiendish puzzles and a full inventory system.
Lashings of atmosphere and gore.
Find all of the tiny dolls scattered about the house.
Unfold a dark story about ritual, blood and survival.
Use your wits to escape this immersive nightmare.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Running Wild
boardgame.description:
It introduces a whole posse of Survivors that can be either on foot, or riding their trusted horses. But it's not all good news, as this expansion also adds the nightmare of a zombie horse!

Each Survivor begins the game on horseback. When they dismount from their horse to enter buildings, their miniatures are swapped and they leave their Lone Horse behind (as a token).

While on horseback, the riders gain skills that enhance their movement and increase their chances of a hit. Individual riders have specialized Blue level skills that add to their repertoire while in Rider mode.

The Running Wild expansion comes with:

6 Survivor Figures
6 Rider Survivor Figures
1 Abomination Figure
6 Survivor ID Cards
1 Abomination Card
6 Lone Horse Tokens
6 Oversized Color Bases
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Lone Horse Pack
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Zombicide: Undead or Alive

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Western Tiles Set
boardgame.description:
A whole extra set of tiles to build custom missions in all shapes and sizes. It includes tiles and tokens from Undead or Alive and the Gears & Guns Campaign Expansion. Extra Tile set includes:


The 9 Tiles from Undead or Alive.
The 3 Train Tiles from Undead or Alive.

An assortment of tokens needed to expand your maps.


-description from Kickstarter campaign
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Zombicide: Undead or Alive

9 Survivors
9 Survivor ID Cards

Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Abominape vs Crocosaur
boardgame.description:
This set adds these two massive abominations to your game.

The Abominape is so large that it treats Survivors as its (very tasty) playthings. If it hasn’t done so already, the Abominape snatches up a Survivor in its zone, disabling them until it has been eliminated by a Dynamite.

The Crocosaur is a hardy monstrosity. When it is hit with a Dynamite or Damage 3 weapon, roll a die. On a 4+, it survives the attack! The only way to guarantee its defeat is to spend 2 Dynamite cards instead of 1 when throwing a Dynamite at it.

The Abominape vs Crocosaur Pack contains:


1 Abominape figure
1 Crocosaur Figure
2 Abomination Cards
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Zombicide: Undead or Alive

boardgame.description: 6 Lone Horse miniatures in 2 variations to be used instead of the cardboard tokens when Survivors dismount from their horses during a game using the Running Wild expansion.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Running Wild

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Metal Steam Dice
boardgame.description: A pack of 6 metal Steam Dice. These special dice are used when going Full Steam with the special equipment found in the Gears & Guns expansion. The numbers in these dice are represented as turning gears, and the '1' is replaced with the Depleted symbol, which indicates the equipment can't be used until it is refilled.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Gears & Guns

boardgame.name: Exotic Insect Swarms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"If your players don't like bugs and creepy crawlies, then good news, here a whole load of new options for insect swarms."

This 13 page monster supplement for 5E has 11 unique new variations on Insect Swarm Monsters to throw at your players.
Fully illustrated to help immerse everyone in the joys of being swarmed by uncountable little monsters...

Includes the following unique Instect Swarms with 5E stat blocks

Anagolic Racer Slugs - These large slimy slugs are coated in a thick alchemical mucus that helps them move very quickly, for a slug species. Contact with this thick mucus can grant a quick burst of speed, but also strains the body.
Dancer Beetles - These scarab like beetles exude a strong pheromone into the air when agitated.
Durande Mitred Crabs - Chunky crabs with a stone like blueish shell, native to cold climates.
Fleshhook Flies - These vicious looking creatures have truly oversized mandibles for their size and will tenaciously bite and tear at any wound they inflict.
Hunger of the Abyss - Non-native to this plane, these creatures swarm through the air and descend upon anything with a pulse.
Murasi Fire Ants - This aggressive species of ant excretes a flammable liquid from their thoraxes.
Reticulated Bile Scorpions - Regarded as one of the more dangerous poisons to be stung with whilst in their native desert, they’re venom is also regarded as a great practical joke amongst certain circles.
Selarni Arrow Frogs - Also known as the Piranha of the canopy, these swarming frogs are covered in small razor sharp barbs and are capable of powerful leaping attacks that have been likened to being hit by a storm of arrow heads.
Sliverback Millipedes - Yellow Coloured millipedes whose bite causes nigh on unbearable itchy welts.
Sorm Worms - These creatures typically lurk on the roof of caves and spit out a mucus laden line to ensnare their victims.
Zzvarvet Mind Grubs - The grubs vomit on their victims, causing them to die hideously as violent hallucinations ruin their minds.

boardgame.name: Plague from Within
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Plague from Within, a group of level-4 adventurers meets the Kokin, a village of tiny fairy-people, like sprites. The Great Father Tree, their creator and protector, is plagued and diseased. The Kokins are dying and need help to cleanse their tree. When the heroes arrive, a group of mercenaries has already settled in. They tried to do the job but after measuring their losses on their first attempts decided it would be better to backstab the tiny people who hired them in the first place.

The Kokins depend on the heroes to survive, and even with their help, it doesn't guarantee a happy ending for them. Regardless of the adventurers' actions, the fate of the Kokins might already be written in stone and come to an end.

boardgame.name: The Drowned
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by classic monsters like the Wraith and Attic Whisperer, this ghastly homebrew who steals the breath from your lungs is something I recently punished my players with; I share it here for you to do the same...if you dare!

I had these unfortunate abominations anchored underwater and limited to a certain range to restrict their potential lethality for the swimming party, but feel free to place these unsettling waterlogged monstrosities wherever you see fit.

boardgame.name: Horror at the Harvest Time Hoedown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A CORN MAZE DUNGEON CRAWL FULL OF ABERRATIONS...AND CIVIL WAR RE-ENACTORS!

The Horror at the Harvest Time Hoedown is an original and over-the-top comedic horror adventure for a level 5 group of adventurers. The adventure features corn monsters, Cornfederate civil war re-enactors, and bitter satire from a jaded ethicist...

Also, did I mention you get to run down cornmen in an old combine harvester with 20 feet of gnashing blades mounted to the front?

This seasonal one-shot allows for between 6-10 hours of gameplay and is optimized for a party of 5th level adventurers.

boardgame.name: How to Cook a Dragon: Enhanced Cooking Rules and Effects for the Pathfinder RPG System
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold! A full-length supplement, How to Cook a Dragon: Enhanced Cooking Rules and Effects for Pathfinder!

Within are new cooking rules, a new condition (nourished), an alchemist archetype (the Gastronomist), and fun new recipes and effects to incorporate into your tabletop games. The supplement is designed for Pathfinder, but can easily be incorporated into other tabletop games (like the 5th version of the other one).

boardgame.name: Gatto Isle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore an uninhabited island, search for what happened to the last humans who tried to explore this island more than a decade ago. Hunt for valuable furs or ivory. Try and found a new colony. Perhaps search for raw diamonds.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Tomten
boardgame.description:
Become one of the friendly, hard-working Scandinavian tomten, completing tasks in preparation for St. Knut's day. Players will compete to collect task cards for a mix of instant rewards and engine building by working and resting their way through the holiday season.

A game takes place on a calendar-themed board beginning on December 1st, culminating on St. Knut's Day on January 13th. Tasks performed will cause resources to be spent, but resting (and some task rewards) can bring those resources back into the ready position. As players collect task cards, they'll build an engine by adding each card's rewards to their train of completion rewards when working, playing, or partying on holidays.

At the end of the game, players will all join together for St. Knut's Day and score final victory bonuses based on the artwork shown on cards they've collected throughout the game. Each card features a unique illustration by Jenny Nyström, a Swedish painter and illustrator famous for her works featuring the jultomte performing tasks throughout the Christmas season.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Dracula Vector
boardgame.description:
[product information page]
For some weeks now, you’ve been on the trail of a vampire in London.

Call him Dracula.

He may or may not be the no-kidding Count Dracula, but he’s definitely cut from the same burial shroud.

You’ve hunted him across London, destroying his refuges and hiding places, denying him his coffins. Maybe tonight will be the night you catch him, and come face to face with your enemy.

Time is running short. Unless you kill him, he’ll spread his curse like a disease. Think of the vampire as a pathogen, a plague – the Dracula Vector.

The Dracula Vector is a short (1-2 session) adventure, designed as an introduction to the Night’s Black Agents RPG, and giving a taste of how a larger mission plays out.

It can also serve as a jumping-off point for a longer Dracula Dossier campaign.

boardgame.name: Warriors of Valhalla
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Honor. Valor. Furious Vengeance.

Winged raiders, black as the night sky itself, strike the Viking village of Kaldt Klif, and its battle-hardened warriors must undertake a harrowing quest of valor and vindication. Come, raise your ale horn in a toast to your fallen ancestors and take up their legendary weapons against the foe! Launch your longship on a voyage of mystery, danger and Viking party games!

Warriors of Valhalla is an epic adventure set in a heroic Viking world where magic is real and battles are won through wit and strength of arms.

boardgame.name: Cleric Domain: Fate Domain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With further understanding of time comes a clear desire to manipulate it in one's favor. Clerics of the Fate Domain are priests, seers, and acolytes who have sworn an oath to uphold a particular version of history and its outcomes.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a cleric character, the Fate Domain gives you options to build a well-studied cleric who feels that they have a greater role to play in the divine tapestry of history.

boardgame.name: The Cape of Old Daemons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cape of Old Daemons is on the fringes of The Red Sun Kingdom. Ancient wrecks and ruins of an age filled with magic and technology are littered across the cape. The Prodigal Caravan, a nomadic tribe of wizards has settled here, attempting to pick clean the ruins. A camp of Red Sun Agents watches over them, ensuring anything of value is returned to the King. Tension simmers between the two groups, while beneath the earth The Hookmen plot the downfall of all…

A fantasy post-apocalyptic adventure location, including:

A town of randomly stocked wizard wagon towers!
Three factions with quests for the Player Characters. Tables for throwing the cape into conflict and chaos!
A generator of magical devices from an ancient age!
A toxic plain of warping, radioactive rocks!
Acidic beaches haunted by the explorable carcasses of industry!
Fields filled with the preserved forms of engineered godlets!
A garden overgrown with mutagenic waste!


Suitable for parties of lower levelled characters.

boardgame.name: Colony of the Neogi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As noon arrives, you and your party find yourselves outside the gate to the community of Gophersburg. No guards are present and your hails go unanswered. A pit grows in your stomach as you realize things are not well...

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for six, mid (4th) level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Prisoners' Dilemma
boardgame.description:
Ruined Relic Games presents:

Prisoners' Dilemma: Inspired by the true life Dyatlov Pass Incident

Strange events are afoot in 1920s Russia. The investigators, all prisoners of the Russian State, have been press-ganged into service in the barren, frozen wilderness of central Russia. As members of the investigators' traveling party are exposed to the machinations of an original Mythos terror, the prisoners will quickly run out of allies as it becomes less and less clear who they can trust, and who--if anyone--might be working for the supernatural forces that hound them.

Presenting a survival horror tone and heavy doses of cosmicism, Prisoners' Dilemma is a slow burn scenario intended for an experienced Keeper and 3 to 6 players. This 55-page module offers a linear plot tinged with heavy degrees of distrust and suspicion, including elements that might lead players to distrust one another. It comes ready to play with 6 pre-generated investigators.

Currently available on DriveThruRPG.

boardgame.name: Dirty Town Quickstarter Zine
boardgame.description:
This is the Quickstarter version of Dirty Town, a sucessfully funded #Zinequest2 Kickstarter campaign. Wait, you don't know what Dirty Town is?

Dirty Town is a cooperative diceless RPG about the corny adventures of Pigeons. Get ready to negotiate with your fellow sparrows, deal with nasty rats, angry cats, evil seagulls and face many more dangers in Dirty Town !

Have you ever wondered what your favourite movie's storyline would be like if the main characters were Pigeons? Of course not, but don't be corny about it. Imagine you could transform The Lords of the Rings into The Feathership of the Wing and play as a Flock of Pigeons travelling throughout Birdgard (which is actually Dirty Town) to destroy The Feather. AMAIZEing, right!?


Dirty Town Quickstarter Zine contains:

Instructions to build your own Dirty Town Quickstarter Zine
A6 zine with 8 pages
Rules of the game
1 ready to play adventure
Character sheets
20 corny Abilities
20 aMAIZEing Items

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Pays Charolais Brionnais: le jeu
boardgame.description:
The game of the Pays Charolais-Brionnais is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the Pays Charolais-Brionnais, Briant, Lugny-les-Charolles, Cronat...
and then go discover all the sites with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities, traditions, heritage....

boardgame.name: Dungeon Hero Core Rules
boardgame.description:
The core rulebook for playing Dungeon Hero. Explains the rules for character creation and gameplay, and provides an example of play.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Castle Charon
boardgame.description:
Robed cultists have been seen filing into the ruins of King Charon's castle. Chanting has been heard, and demons have been sighted. Can you set things right?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Fortress of the Frost Giant Jarl
boardgame.description:
Freezing and starving, you find a Viking outpost, but to stay with them for the winter, you must help them put down the Frost Giant jarl.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: GWASL IV – Samsonov's Army: Russian Great War
boardgame.description:
GWASL IV Samsonov’s Army takes the action to the Great War’ Eastern Front and pits the soldiers of General Ludendorff against invading Russians under General Samsonov. The dark forests, forced-marches, and human waves of a low-morale, poorly led force ... face the crack troops of a still ascendant Germany. The horror of a two-front war is upon the Kaiser’s best leaders and there is only one way out: total victory.

Historians know the battle took place near Allenstein. However, General Erich Ludendorff named it after Tannenberg, some 30 klicks to the west, to avenge the defeat of the Teutonic Knights at the earlier battle of the same name that occurred in 1410.

The world was a far different place during the summer of 1914. Germany was on the offensive on the Western Front. Trench warfare had yet to set in. Crowds, out in the streets welcomed war with open arms, and cheers. A massive Russian Army headed for East Prussia, and eventually, the heart of Germany ... in an unprecedented invasion—ten Russian Armies in all could be mobilized. Hindenburg was called out of retirement to manage the German side along with Ludendorff. Despite overwhelming numerical advantages by the enemy, the battle resulted in the almost complete destruction of the Russian Second Army, and the suicide of its commanding general, Alexander Samsonov.

A series of follow-up battles (1st Masurian Lakes) destroyed most of the First Army as well, and kept the Russians off-balance until the spring of 1915. The Battle of Tannenberg set the stage for the First Battle of the Masurian Lakes a week later, where the reinforced German Eighth Army now faced only the Russian First Army and forced it back over the prewar border.
Russian forces would not again march on German soil until the end of World War II.
Ownership of GWASL I is required.
Includes eight scenarios, two sheets of counters, all the geo boards needed to play the scenarios, folio, and special rules.

Scenarios:

Opening Blow – Stalluponen, East Prussia, August 17th 1914
Disaster at Gumbinnen - Gumbinnen, East Prussia 1914
Fresh Blood – Usdau, East Prussia, August 27th 1914
Samsonov’s End – Frogenau, East Prussia, August 29th 1914
The Kerensky Offensive – Lvov, Ukraine, July 1st 1917
Sacrifice for Joffre – Vilna, Russia, March 20th 1916
Action Along the Wilja – Vileyka, Russia, September 22nd 1915
East of Sosenka – East of Sosenka, Russia, September 24th 1915
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: GWASL IX – Bulgarian Summer: Bulgarian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL V – Hapsburg Ambitions: Austria-Hungary
ASL Comp: GWASL VI – Blood on the Isonzo: Italian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VII – Soldiers of the Sultan: Turkish WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VIII – Gallipoli and Beyond: ANZAC WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL X – Slavic Warriors: Serbian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL XI – Balkan Aspirations: Romanian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL XII – With the British in Palestine: British and Irregular
Advanced Squad Leader

boardgame.name: Web of the Spider Queen
boardgame.description:
The Queen of Spiders seeks to conquer the sunlit world above. Can you stop her before she rises?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Tower of the Terrapin
boardgame.description:
The Terrapin Cult hoards the only cure a beloved mentor needs. But can friends made in the City of Scoundrels be trusted to help infiltrate the tower?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Lost Island
boardgame.description:
Shipwrecked on an island that was nowhere to be found on the maps, you struggle to survive on an island stuck in time.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The New Hill
boardgame.description:
A massive mound of dirt and sand appears in a farmer's field. What terrors does it herald?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Full Moon Frenzy
boardgame.description:
Something is stalking the night under the light of the full moon. Can you stop its rampage?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Terror of Talonberg
boardgame.description:
A fortune-teller has read to you her cards, but can her prophecies really help you destroy the evil terrorizing the town?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Pyramid of Semerkhet
boardgame.description:
Dehydrated and exhausted, you see the pyramid on the horizon. If not water, at least shade may be found – but what other horrors await you in that awful tomb?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Creature of the Ebon Fen
boardgame.description:
A group of scholars have hired you to escort them to a lagoon of biological interest, but are the rare fish there worth the risk of entering the unknown jungle?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: PrimEVO
boardgame.description:
At the dawn of man, tribes fought against both nature and others of their own kind to secure their slim chance at survival. Their ability to adapt and evolve in the face of constant hardship allowed the strongest of those tribes to succeed. You are in control of one of these tribes, and their future is entirely in your hands.

PrimEVO is a miniatures agnostic skirmish system intended to be played solo or among a group of people. It offers quick gameplay (1 vs 1) and offers not only world challenges that all tribes must face together, but also those that they will have to overcome individually. Literally no two campaigns will be alike.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: PrimEVO: Gods & Nightmares

boardgame.name: ATTLO: Avoid Taking The Last One
boardgame.description:
Nim variants with six different boards and fifteen counters. Players take turns to remove one or two adjacent counters that must be joined by a black line. The player who is forced to take the last counter loses the game.

Variant 1: players take turns to remove at least one counter or at most a row of counters provided there is no missing counters in between.

Variant 2: players take turns to remove from one to three adjacent counters with no missing counters in between, but a players must not take the same number of counters as the previous player.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: GWASL V – Hapsburg Ambitions: Austria-Hungary
boardgame.description:
A key player in the Central Powers, Austria-Hungary and its territorial ambitions represented a match to the tinder-box that become World War I.
The Hapsburgs, namely Emperor Franz Josef, dreamed the dreams of conquerors. Ever an expansionist, Josef’s latest conquest was Bosnia-Herzegovina. And it was a Bosnian Serb that assassinated Crown Prince Franz Ferdinand, in Sarajevo. The Austrian ultimatum to Serbia followed on 28 July 1914. On 1 August Germany declared war on Russia, the protector of the Slavs. Within a few days Austria declared war on Russia, then on Belgium on 7 August. By the end of 1914, Austria-Hungary and Germany would be at war with France, Britain and Japan, and later, following the attack on Serbia, Montenegro. There were setbacks in the campaign against Russia in Galicia. The Austrian army had more success in 1915, and by the middle of 1916 had conquered Serbia and Montenegro, pushed the Russians back from Poland and by the end of 1916 a combined German-Austrian-Bulgarian attack knocked out Romania. The Austrians also had to face Italian attacks on the South Tirol and the Isonzo River. It was the success of British and French reinforcements, reaching the Balkans and Italy, that forced the Austrian Emperor to sue for peace in October 1918. On 29 October, as the Austrian Army fell back from the Piave River, British and Italian aircraft fired into the fleeing columns.
The Austrian armistice took effect on 4 November 1918.
A total of 1,495,200 Austro-Hungarian soldiers died during World War I.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL I and all preceding GWASL modules are required to play.

Scenarios:

Polish Legion – Kostiuchnowka, Ukraine, June 8th 1916
Bread Not Blood – Radoszyce, Galicia, November 20th 1914
Brzo, Brzo! – Radoszyce, Hungary, November 17th 1914
Polish Hill – Kolki, Hungary, July 4th 1916
To The Very Last Hour – Przemysl, Galicia, March 20th 1915
Cossack Terror – Buczacz, Hungary, June 8th 1916
Opportunity In Bukovina – Okna, Austria-Hungary, June 6th 1916
The Rojische Bridgehead – Rojische, Ukraine, June 9th 1916
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: GWASL IX – Bulgarian Summer: Bulgarian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VI – Blood on the Isonzo: Italian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VII – Soldiers of the Sultan: Turkish WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VIII – Gallipoli and Beyond: ANZAC WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL X – Slavic Warriors: Serbian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL XI – Balkan Aspirations: Romanian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL XII – With the British in Palestine: British and Irregular
Advanced Squad Leader
ASL Comp: GWASL II – Blasted Woods: French Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL III – Over There! American Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL IV – Samsonov's Army: Russian Great War

boardgame.name: Escape From Mars
boardgame.description:
You are not alone...

Escape from Mars is a single player hidden traitor game.

An alien virus has infected the crew of Mars Base Epsilon, the first off world colony, and strange insect like creatures swarm the outpost. Players must discover and quarantine the alien host, living among them, inside one of the crew, they must also gather alien gene samples, then via the communication room, request rescue. It’s a race against time as crew become infected, drone aliens will be drawn to the colony until eventually an alpha alien will arrive and wreak havoc on the colony and its crew.

Scour the colony for useful items and weapon, locate the clues to discover the alien host and send them to quarantine, keep crew infection down, research the alien gene sample codes, deal with crisis events and distrustful crew members, seal off parts of the base and set defenses, send the robot to rescue fallen crew, prepare medicines and vaccines, stock up on ammo, jump in a space suit and search the plant surface, destroy the alien drones then hold out until the rescue ship arrives, just make sure you get home...alone.

The game is played over a set number of rounds (which also determined the difficulty), a crew marker counts down the rounds and at the other end of the round tracker an Alien marker moves in the opposite direction, if the markers ever meet, the Alpha Alien will arrive and the ‘Host’ crew member will die.... or evolve?

Players start off with a limited number of active crew, some must be rescued, other will be distrustful and need convincing to join. Player must scour the ship looking for clues as to the identity of the Alien Host, looking for blood samples and crew logs, players also need to gather alien samples for HQ. The colony is also full of weapons, tools, events, and more. Players risk crew when venturing out in colony as the longer they search, the more exposure to the alien virus they risk. The game is about managing and taking risks, use your crew wisely as they have different strengths and weaknesses.

The game ends and the players win, when they have discovered and quarantined the Alien Host, found and reported the Alien samples to HQ, all get into the airlock and the rescue ship arrives.

The player loose if no one makes it out alive, and this can happen in many ways...

boardgame.name: Turbulences: Collector's Edition
boardgame.description:
Turbulences is a pick-up-and-deliver game in which players need to pay attention to the weather — and the mountains! — while making their way from town to town.


The Collector's Edition includes every component in one box: the basic game, the expert mode, the mystery box and the collector pack, including, e.g. three legendary aircrafts.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
This is a new unpunched Collector's edition. Please note that it is not in shrinkwrap because the game producer wished to consider the environmental impact of their game.
This game will ship to the UK only.
From kickstarter COLLECTOR'S EDITION CORE GAME + STRETCH GOALS +EXPERT MODE English edition

FULL COLLECTOR'S EDITION. Box number 1024. New and unpunched. Note that it is not in shrinkwrap because the game producer wished to consider the environmental impact of their game.
Postage within UK will be £5. Contact me for international shipping. Payment by Paypal F&F only.

boardgame.name: Seinfeld: The Party Game About Nothing
boardgame.description:
Celebrate the hit ’90s TV show in this hilarious head-to-head party game that will challenge what you know about the “show about nothing.”

Score points by answering trivia questions, charades-style acting, and guessing who said or did some of the most hilarious bits ever aired on television! You’ll even get a chance to fish for the marble rye like George and Jerry did!

It’s hundreds of Seinfeld-celebrating activities for outrageous fun!

Players will form teams of two and each turn roll the challenge die. There are five types of challenges and one "Newman!" icon. The different challenges will be asked to the current team and if they get them correct they will score some points.

The first team to 70 points or more wins! However if both teams have at least 50 points, one team may skip their regular turn to attempt the Marble Rye dexterity challenge (yes, just like the show!)

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: A Scientific Discourse on the Nature of the Universe
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is not a normal RPG style production. In fact, if you have no interest in World Building or Physics then it is probably of no interest to you whatsoever. The "Universe" of the title isn't even the real Universie but the FRPG style play setting Universe of the World of Barnaynia.

This document is written in the style of a scientific paper written by two fictional scholars baring a passing resemblance to the real authors. It is a protracted pice of navel-gazing illuminated with some amusing side-lines, all set int he Bizarre World of Barnaynia and the Land of the Young.

This is pure indulgeance but if you are still reading then you might, just might, find it amusing and/or interesting and thought provoking.

boardgame.name: The Tome of Settlements
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ultimate guide to generating your own villages, hamlets, cities, and more!

Within this book are dozens of tables and information to help you randomly generate your own settlements. You can generate things like:

Name of the Settlement
Type of Settlement
Encounters in your Settlement
Shops and Services in your Settlement
The Government of your Settlement

boardgame.name: The Tome of Dwarves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ultimate guide to creating memorable and interesting dwarf characters!

Within this book are dozens of tables and information to help create a memorable, exciting Dwarf character. This book contains the following tables:

Male and Female Dwarf Names
Hundreds of Dwarf Clan Names
Physical and Personality Traits for Dwarves
Dwarven Bonds, Ideals, and Flaws
Dwarven Mountain Hall Names
Dwarven Trinkets

boardgame.name: Foosketball
boardgame.description: Shoot hoops head-to-head! First player to score 5 points wins.

boardgame.name: PrimEVO: Gods & Nightmares
boardgame.description:
Gods & Monsters is the first expansion for PrimEVO and deals with Jurassic elements of play including more scenarios, more additional rules, 11 dinosaur species each with their own AI, and a system allowing your tribe to build their God as they see fit while periodically bringing them to the battlefield, all of which can be incorporated with everything in the core book.

- description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: PrimEVO

boardgame.name: The Sound of Metal
boardgame.description:
The Sound of Metal is a fully cooperative (or solo) tabletop miniatures skirmish game. With a rogue-lite campaign system, players take on the roles of survivors of humans, trying to get by after the downfall of civilization, a result of the Great Robot Uprising.

After a large meteor crashes into the planet, the Robot overlords start to experience communication issues and many start to malfunction. Humans dubbed this event as "The Glitch" and see it as their opportunity to take back their planet. This is no easy task, as the human population is just a fraction of what it once was, and communication is a challenge. Although the Robots have been greatly disrupted, they are still, in every sense of the word, a great threat.

Players create survivors, find a vehicle, and traverse the countryside, gathering resources, finding food and weapons, and learning skills to complete mission objectives. In doing so, players characters will level up, gain notoriety, and try to find and destroy the machines central core.

The game features an action-point based system - These points double as action points and your characters health. As your character takes wounds, they lose action points. Run out of action points, and you collapse.

Combat/skill checks are performed by rolling dice, bolstered by stats and gained skills.

Similar to the great tactical, turn-based video games of the 90s, such as X-Com and Jagged Alliance, players can spend extra action points to perform actions at higher levels of competency, being able to aim, change their stances, or focus on specific tasks.

Enemies are controlled by the game's AI - each enemy has its own order of operations reactionary programming. Players face these enemies in campaign missions, as well as random encounters.

The world unfolds in front of the players - as they track their progress on the overworld map. Moving costs food and fuel, and dangers lurk around every corner. The map is be randomly generated each game, and players will find settlements, points of interest and missions in different areas every game.

Players never control more than 6 survivors at a time, and can be played with 1-6 players cooperatively, splitting up the survivors among players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Introducing: Kaleidoscope RPG Combat Damage Cards
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This document presents alternate rules for using specialized cards to drive combat. The document includes one page of instructions and eight pages of print-cut-and-play cards.
boardgame.rpg: Kaleidoscope: A Simple Roleplaying System For Complex Realities

boardgame.name: The New Game Of War
boardgame.description:
Each player has nine pawns. Two players may play as allies. The goal of the game is to score points by entering the citadel in the center of the game board an by capturing enemy pieces.

Movement is one space per turn in any direction, but not diagonal. The pawns may capture enemies by jumping over them. Capture in mandatory if possible. Allied pawns may be jumped over but are not captured. Jumping over pawns of the same color is not permitted.

Pawns that reach the citadel are put out of the game, if they are not compelled to leave right away to capture an enemy pawn. Captured pawns are exchanged and reenter the game on the spaces of the same color.

The game ends, when one allied party has no pawn left on the board or, if there are no allies, when only pawns of one color remain on the board.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens Pack 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

Additional batch of CR 1/2 SRD Creatures + Start on CR 1 also!

This pack contains 10 new Creature Tokens + 2 Updated tokens (Ghoul A/B), each with multiple color variants:

Total # of tokens in this pack: 136!

boardgame.name: Modular Skeletons Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We usually do all of our assets in 200dpi, but these were made in 400dpi (same as tokens) so for a proper scale you want to drop the size to 50%, But you can also use them for Giants at full size! ^^ so that’s a small bonus.

This pack contains a Lot of individual bones, skulls, torsos, ribs, spines feet/hands all in 2 color variants and also in broken/cracked state, so you can build your own skeletons in various poses.

There are 8 pre-constructed skeletons included and also scaling references if you want to do Dwarf/Halfling or even Dragonborn ^^

Total # of Assets in this pack: 197!

boardgame.name: Death & Decay Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Happy Halloween and Happy Samhain!

Here’s some gore to get you in the spooky spirit!

This pack contains bodies in various stages of decay and dismemberment, as well as some nice new blood overlays.

This is definitely the sort of pack you want to check in with your players before you use! Some people have weaker stomachs than others.

But we hope this pack will come in handy for some of you or give you a leg up in planning future demise of your party. Will they panic and lose their heads? Or spill their guts laughing ?

Total # of Assets in this pack: 206!

boardgame.name: Astral Dreadnought
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second Huge/Gargantuan/Gigantic monster that we’ve decided to tackle is Astral Dreadnaught!

Properly Gargantuan at 16×22 at full scale or 8×11 for it’s Torso to fit into 4×4 “Gargantuan” square.

Available in 12 color variants and 2 versions:
A – Normal Tail
B – “Infinite” Tail

So you can choose whichever you prefer

boardgame.name: Teddy's Adventures: Buttons & Write
boardgame.description:
The life of the little stuffed Teddy comes to life at night, his duty is to take care of the dreams of his child, throughout the hours of the night he must go through a series of adventures with the aim that his child wakes up as calm possible, but you must be careful, the world of nightmares is open and Little Guss is prowling the room, you will have to collect as many magic buttons as possible to help protect your child's dreams.

The Teddy's Adventures is a roll & write style game but with buttons instead of dice, it is played by taking colored buttons out of a bag, from these buttons the active player will choose which buttons will be painted in each section of his game sheet and which button It will be eliminated, in addition to which button the other players will paint, the game sheet will fill with colors as the rules explain, and you will have to check the progress of the board of the world of nightmares that can trigger the end sooner than provided. Once the end of the game is triggered, points will be counted in each section of the sheet and the player who scores more points than the others will win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Shards of the Storm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In celebration of the release of Rime of the Frostmaiden and the (hopefully) cooling weather as we move into the fall and winter seasons of the year, a collection of 36 TTRPG content creators have come together to create a massive 150×180 grid map with new monsters, ambient music, miniatures, and magic items to all complement one another!

This is our contribution to the collaboration, 3 maps and 6 Tokens

boardgame.name: The Armory
boardgame.description:
The Armory acts as 100DOS' Warfare series of tabletop games. Similar to Mythic, The Armory is a system built to allow players to play through combat through different eras. The current alpha lets people pick from over 250 modern weapons, use a modular vehicle creation system, and gain access to hundreds of pieces of equipment and armor. The Armory also has upcoming splatbooks for Medieval Warfare, World War 1, and Middle Ages Asia. These will offer more weapons, more scenarios, and more timelines and options for all players to choose from. Keep an eye out for more!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Tri-Dice
boardgame.description:
Tri-Dice is a unique, quirky fun two person game. Both players move around a two track board, obtaining playing cards and optionally switching tracks, trying to score points. First player to 30 points wins. Sounds simplistic but there are many twists which require a good deal of strategy. For example, players may "capture" each other leading to cat and mouse chases.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Horizon Wars: Infinite Dark
boardgame.description: Horizon Wars: Infinite Dark is a science-fiction spaceship tabletop miniatures wargame. It allows for solitaire, co-operative, and competitive versus play. Players create a fleet of ships, customizing both their statistics and their heroic pilots. When played solo or cooperatively, the AI adversary is controlled through an AI and a standard deck of playing cards. Scenarios are objective-based and range from one-off encounters to narrative campaigns, complete with character progression.

boardgame.name: Entre os Feixes
boardgame.description:
To play Entre os Feixes, you just have to grab some bottle caps, print two sheets to cut out, and the rules.

The story of this game takes place thousands of years ago, in the city of Bethlehem of Judea, when poor people collected, among the plantations, ears of wheat and barley that fell to the ground, to satisfy their own hunger. Ruth, the protagonist of the story, is one of these people, a young and foreign widow looking for ways to support her mother-in-law, picking ears in a plantation in the region, because according to Jewish law on behalf the hungry, it was justice for the owners of land to leave the ears that fell to the ground for people in need to collect for themselves. The game is based on chapter 2 from the book of Ruth of the Bible, telling the story of this notorious young foreigner who, because of her faithfulness and dedication, marries the owner of the plantation and joins the genealogical line of Jesus Christ.

A game that, through its mechanics, can be used to address issues such as: social equality, self-preservation, respect for women, the value of loyalty, work, and the correct authority that cares and leads people in a loving way.

In summary, each player plays with 3 pieces that move like queens, but instead of capturing the opponent's pieces, they capture the squares of the board, collecting them to sum points at the end of the game.

(Description by the designer)

boardgame.name: Monopoly: The Lord of The Rings Edition
boardgame.description:
MONOPOLY GAME: THE LORD OF THE RINGS EDITION: Protect the lands of Middle-earth from the armies of Mordor with this Monopoly game inspired by The Lord of the Rings movie trilogy
RING OF POWER: Control the Ring and get special powers, but beware! The longer a player has the Ring, the more dangerous it becomes. Rolling the Eye of Sauron can make someone pay a heavy price
MEMBERS OF THE FELLOWSHIP CHARACTER TOKENS: Play as Frodo, Gandalf, Sam, Aragorn, Legolas, Gimli, Pippin, Merry, or Boromir
PATH TO MOUNT DOOM: The player who has the Ring also moves a Ring Tracker along a line of circles on the gameboard toward Mount Doom. Lose or give away the Ring and the Tracker moves back to Start

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: weight: 994 grams + packaging

boardgame.name: Venice: Screen-Printed Components Set
boardgame.description:
Screen-printed versions of several wooden components in the game, included with pledges during the 2020 Kickstarter campaign. Packaged outside of the sealed game box. Includes the screen-printed version of the following wooden tokens:

1 Spy Piece
1 End Game Marker
5 Score Track Markers (1 in each player color)
5 Scroll Tracker Markers (1 in each player color)
5 Intrigue Tracker Markers (1 in each player color)

boardgame.name: DELVE: Feast and Famine Expansion
boardgame.description:
The First expansion to DELVE, Feast and Famine introduces the Hunger mechanics from UMBRA to your dwarvish holds. To stave off starvation, you'll have to use the new farming rooms like the Forge-Bee Apiary, Mushroom Gardens, or Cave Goat Milking Sheds.

Crops can then be processed to create special benefits like STR bonuses, unique adventurers, new golems, and more.

Feast and Famine also introduces Cave Goats, horrific dwellers of the depths that dwarves keep for their famously magical cheese. There are 6 species to find, each with their own unique benefits.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game

boardgame.name: A Decade of TravCon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A compilation of a decade of after action reports from the United Kingdom’s Traveller Convention held at Redwings Lodge.

With photos, fun and fantastic role playing across dozens of games, this acts as a memory book for those who were there, an encouragement to come for those who may be able to in the future, and an inspiration as to what’s possible for those who may never be able to be there in person.

Full disclosure: These reports were originally published in various issues of Freelance Traveller across the years. Some revisions have been made and links and see references have been updated. In addition, a comprehensive index has been added as well as additional material from the author's archives.

boardgame.name: Backyard of Frutabaja
boardgame.description:
Some little gnomes want to start their life as bussiness landlords in the Backyard of Frutabaja, but a monster living there is trying to scare off al clients with dirt.

Players must work as a team to keep the board clean at the same time they try to settle new bussinesses and earn money.

The winner is determined scoring points and reaching goals. But each players will lose if the Blorrrdo places each dirt token in the backyard.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aldmill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inspired by a Wild West town on the coast of a lake, this sandy-colored map huddles around a small harbor and features a train track and hill-side mining operations.

boardgame.name: An Gearesdan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sleepy island town of An Gearesdan was a private project Alyssa undertook for her own Pathfinder campaign. Inspired by the local Oregon coastline, Alyssa was one day sitting and admiring the small bay in front of her, when she noticed how it had a wonderful “hook” near the entrance. Inspired by the possibilities for a harbor fort to be location there, this entire little town was given birth as a result.

boardgame.name: Black Bat
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This holds the crown for the first commission Alyssa ever did, and it is a vampire city surrounded by dead forests! This map was drawn with ink on paper, but still exudes Alyssa’s attention to detail: gothic rooftops, looming gargoyles, and darkened alley ways!

boardgame.name: Brycshire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for Jim Pinto and his King for a Day game setting; an extensive campaign-adventure-sandbox set in a semi-historic valley called Brycshire, which is roughly the equivalent of circa 800 A.D. Anglo-Saxony. This is one of the most beautiful maps Alyssa has drawn: it’s vibrant colors and refreshing top-down view give a great sense of depth and wonder: don’t you just wan tto explore this valley?

boardgame.name: Dubrovnik
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A personal project for Alyssa Faden and her own Pathfinder game, she decided to model a city upon the wonderful real-world town of Dubvrovnik (later to become famous as one of the filming locations for Game of Thrones). For this map, Alyssa used Google maps to get every key features captured – right down to ocean boulders – while ignoring the more modern aspects. Thus we see Dubvrovnik is all of its medieval glory.

boardgame.name: Edgepond
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project Alyssa drew for her Patrons on Patreon: this is fjord-inspired piece featuring a couple of villages and icy waters!

boardgame.name: Fighter Bomber
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For use in any setting or systems where adventure awaits. These products will be useful for any sci-fi or space themed role-playing rules system. whether you are creating a world or playing in one

boardgame.name: Foxdell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Originally drawn ink-on-paper for Mike Nystul’s “Infinite Dungeon” project. Sadly, this project never saw the light of day, but this incredible map lives on. The depth of these hills, the rich colors, and the believable growth of the fortress all combine to make this a visually striking map.

boardgame.name: Freighter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For use in any setting or systems where adventure awaits. These products will be useful for any sci-fi or space themed role-playing rules system. whether you are creating a world or playing in one.

boardgame.name: Freighter 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For use in any setting or systems where adventure awaits. These products will be useful for any sci-fi or space themed role-playing rules system. whether you are creating a world or playing in one.

boardgame.name: Grassy Spur
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Originally drawn ink on paper, "Grassy Spur" is unusual in that it required Alyssa to use Google Maps, zoom in to a specific area of the country, and copy its topography. Then she added features for the adventure: train tracks, baseball diamond, and mines.

boardgame.name: Icewell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project by Alyssa Faden, originally drawn when she was still in England for her personal D&D campaign. Ink on paper and colored digitally, this map features the insane neighborhoods, intricate alleyways, and believable geography that would later become Alyssa’s instantly recognizable style.

boardgame.name: Luxemburg Star Fortress
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A personal project Alyssa undertook for her patrons on Patreon, this star fortress was drawn while streaming and involves a whole host of audience ideas and participation: a wizards college, sprawling aviary, affluent gardens, and more humble farms. Every neighborhood, every building, every street, and every alleyway is meticulously drawn in high detail for this fantasy version of Luxemburg star fortress.

boardgame.name: Mallowham
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project Alyssa created as a donation for a writer’s competition. This huddled little village or small town, straddles a narrow river, with cliff-top homes looking down on the harbor below. Alyssa added plenty of plot hooks for this one so writers could really get inspired: burned down structures, distant communities, and dozens of points of interest. What will YOU create in Mallowham?

boardgame.name: Merrowshore
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project by Alyssa Faden, originally drawn when she was still in England for her personal D&D campaign. Ink on paper and colored digitally, this map features the insane neighborhoods, intricate alleyways, and believable geography that would later become Alyssa’s instantly recognizable style.
