For use in any setting or systems where adventure awaits. These products will be useful for any sci-fi or space themed role-playing rules system. whether you are creating a world or playing in one.

boardgame.name: Sligas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private commission, originally drawn ink-on-paper. This twin-river city draws with its poorer out-district looks like a gaping maw: something Alyssa tells us was completely accidental!

boardgame.name: Sokurah
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for James Carpio (Chapter 13 Press) - Tales from the Fallen Empire. When a client asks for the city to conjure “an Egyptian theme” and we dig into the “well, what if we look at scarab beetles?” inspiration bag. This was one of the most beautiful maps Alyssa has ever drawn; a true head turner.

boardgame.name: Starryfield
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project by Alyssa Faden, originally drawn when she was still in England for her personal D&D campaign. Ink on paper and colored digitally, this map features the insane neighborhoods, intricate alleyways, and believable geography that would later become Alyssa’s instantly recognizable style.

boardgame.name: Summercoast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project by Alyssa Faden, originally drawn when she was still in England for her personal D&D campaign. Ink on paper and colored digitally, this map features the insane neighborhoods, intricate alleyways, and believable geography that would later become Alyssa’s instantly recognizable style.

boardgame.name: Summerfort
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for Silver Gryphon Games in 2013, this city of 13,000 people is a city of intrigue, a city of traders, explorers, madmen, and murderers, against a backdrop of rolling hills and luscious woods.

boardgame.name: Taux City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for R Scott Taylor as part of the larger city of Blackgate, this was one district. The sport stadium appearance is intentional, with this former structure now overrun by plant life and huddled shacks. Originally drawn ink on paper, the details of this piece are outstanding: little bridges between buildings, old game courts still in place, or garden communities now sprawling up the former seating areas.

boardgame.name: The Fallen God Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Originally drawn ink-on-paper for Mike Nystul’s “Infinite Dungeon” project. Sadly, this project never saw the light of day, but this incredible map lives on. This is how Alyssa Faden imagined the island when it was described as “like a god had fallen into the ocean”. We see the outlines of the head, sprawling arms, torso, and legs disappearing under the waves.

boardgame.name: Vaatmery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project by Alyssa Faden, originally drawn when she was still in England for her personal D&D campaign. Ink on paper and colored digitally, this map features the insane neighborhoods, intricate alleyways, and believable geography that would later become Alyssa’s instantly recognizable style.

boardgame.name: Violetnesse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A private project by Alyssa Faden, originally drawn when she was still in England for her personal D&D campaign. Ink on paper and colored digitally, this map features the insane neighborhoods, intricate alleyways, and believable geography that would later become Alyssa’s instantly recognizable style.

boardgame.name: Whisper Vale
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for Zach Glazar and his ENnie nominated Whisper & Venom; this is the close-up of a farmland region. This was one of the first maps Alyssa ever drew digitally and introduced her now-famous clouds, forests and farms.

boardgame.name: Y'Mataar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for James Carpio (Chapter 13 Press) - Tales from the Fallen Empire. When a client asks for the city to conjure “an Egyptian theme” and we dig into the “well, what if we look at scarab beetles?” inspiration bag. This was one of the most beautiful maps Alyssa has ever drawn; a true head turner. This beautiful piece pairs well with Sokurah, where the two explore two different scarab shapes.

boardgame.name: Village 1
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A small village near a stream, available depicting various seasons.

boardgame.name: Uruk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drawn for Tales From the Fallen Empire.

User summary:

A city available in various season and lighting versions.

boardgame.name: Snow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A snow, snaw or snauw is a square-rigged vessel with two masts, complemented by a snow- or trysail-mast stepped immediately abaft (behind) the main mast. A snow had been the largest two-masted ship for many centuries. His weight was around 1000 tons. As almost an identical ship to a brig, snow carried the square sails on both fore-mast and main-mast. A snow was also equipped with an additional trysail mast (used during storm to keep a ship from the wind) which was behind the main-mast. These ships were used for both, battle and merchant purposes. Usually around 80 seamen were boarded. A battle version (Naval Snow) was larger and better armed for the military purposes. Up to 10 cannons were mounted on only one gun deck.

boardgame.name: Caravel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small, fast Spanish or Portuguese sailing ship of the 15th–17th centuries. The Iberian workhorse known as the caravel was one of the most important ships not only in Iberian history, but in the history of the world. The caravel was a vessel of paramount importance in the 15th and 16th centuries, when it was used to traverse the immense barrier to the New World.

boardgame.name: Cog
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A cog is a type of ship that first appeared in the 10th century, and was widely used from around the 12th century on. Cogs were clinker-built, generally of oak. These vessels were fitted with a single mast and a square-rigged single sail.

boardgame.name: The City of the Red Pox
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As the plague season rises to its zenith, the people of Antar rise or fall with it. Nobles settle vendetta three generations in the making. Merchant houses sink one another’s ships in the harbour, as social norms break down around them.

Worse yet, the Princess Dressed in Yellow Silks assaults the walls of reality. From between the million spheres, where anti-suns play, she summons horrors untold.

All will be judged.

boardgame.name: Christmas with the Krampus Splatbook
boardgame.description:
A Very Special 3 Page Christmas Splatbook
Hey, everyone! I've come bearing a gift to all! The very first micro-splatbook! I hope you all enjoy the riveting splatbook 'Christmas with the Krampus'!

Do your players have what it takes to defeat the Krampus in this universal adventure, which will work with any and all 100DOS games.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: World War 1 Splatbook
boardgame.description:
Hey, everyone. It's finally here. After being put on the backburner for well over a year, it has been resurrected and given new life. The original version of the book began work in January of 2018 under the title of "The Great War." It was to be a standalone game like with the Medieval Europe and MIddle Ages Asia games. I had then realized it would be better to do The Armory, as well as get back to Mythic.

Now WWI returns as an expansion to either Mythic or The Armory. It will work with either, and has been modified to work with any completed 100DOS handbook. The current layout is also future-proofed for Mythic Beta 3.5's future release.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Civilian Character Creation Splatbook
boardgame.description:
Here is the mini-splatbook for Civilian character creation! This small splatbook will expand Civilian character creation to allow them more options, specifically a job selection that give them a specialization pack at character creation. These specialization packs are similar to the ones the other Soldier Types gain, but simpler. There are 20 to choose from, and players will be able to keep them and gain a full specialization pack if they become a combat-based soldier type. These also work with Covenant soldier types and all other 100DOS books.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ONI Splatbook
boardgame.description:
The ONI Splatbook is the first splatbook released for 100DOS and Halo Mythic. This splatbook adds additional content for players to use. The main two additions of the ONI splat are new ONI Soldier Types and Cryo weaponry and armor.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Score
boardgame.description:
Recreate the thrill of modern day crime, where crews plan and execute big-time heists. But the best laid plans rarely work out the way you'd like. Work together to pull off the job before the heat gets too high, and you or your friends end up behind bars. Ready to make some money?

Score is an ENnie nominated rules-lite tabletop RPG designed for fast paced and high energy crime. This 36 page PDF contains the rules for play, character sheets, and tons of resources to generate a wide variety of heists. All you need are a pile of six sided dice, some character sheets, and a desire to steal some cold, hard cash.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Micro Score
boardgame.description:
Micro Score takes the rules of the Score RPG and boils them down to their essentials for the perfect one-shot heist. Grab a group and start going on runs today!

All you need are a handful of d6, a pen, and this 1 page RPG. Print out the sheet, cut and fold it to create a mini zine and you'll be playing in no time.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Seasons
boardgame.description:
Seasons Change, Power Shifts
The city of Solstice sits at the center of the Fey Wilds, a bastion of order in a chaotic realm. Inside, the four noble Courts, named for the seasons of the mortals, have an ongoing dance for power and influence. The Houses, families generations old, practice their crafts and trades, in service to the Courts and the city as a whole. You come from one such House, and are proud of it.

You are a Mask, agents of House Masks, hired by the Courts to stab one another in the back while smiling politely. Seasons is a game of political intrigue, espionage, and crime. Each session is a Performance, so play to get that standing ovation.

Seasons is a tabletop RPG based on the Resistance system made famous in Spire and Heart. However, Seasons uses a simplified version of the system, what I call Resistance-Lite. You may be familiar with that type of game if you've played my game Corvid Court. All you need are a pile of d6, and some character sheets!

Included in the game:


44 page full color PDF, in spreads and pages format
Rules of play
4 Courts and 4 Houses, to create your Mask
Resources for creating a Performance, a session of play
A framework of lore for the Fey city of Solstice. From the Fey themselves, to the Courts, and the literal reshaping of the city as the seasons change. But I leave spaces for you to fill, to play and find out
Full color and printer friendly character sheet

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: Das Kartenspiel – Helden-Pack Drax
Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – Drax Pack de Héroe
Marvel Champions: Il Gioco di Carte – Drax: Pack Eroe
Marvel Champions: Le Jeu De Cartes – Drax
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Drax Hero Pack
漫威群英传：德拉克斯英雄补充包
boardgame.description:
Killed by Thanos in a wicked act of cruelty, Arthur Douglas was reincarnated as Drax, a knife-wielding warrior with a thirst for vengeance. Now a member of the Guardians of the Galaxy, Drax travels far and wide, driven and determined to put an end to the mad titan once and for all.

As a member of the Guardians of the Galaxy, Drax charges into the scene with unrelenting fury in this expansion pack, which introduces Drax as a brand-new playable hero, along with his fifteen signature cards. With a pre-built Protection deck ready to go, you’ll be able to try out Drax’s unique vengeance-fueled gameplay from the moment you open the box. Punish the villains who wrong you and show them why Drax is a force to be reckoned with!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Norsun muisti
boardgame.description:
An educational memory game about nature preservation. Find pairs of animals, connect animal families and plant protective forest for them. Can also be played as a classic memory game.

The game includes 16 animal species (2 adults and one baby each), and baobab trees as home trees for species. You try to find the pairs and deliver them to safety. Winner is the one with most animals saved.

boardgame.name: Choco Challenge
boardgame.description:
Each year, the most skillful master chocolatiers coming from the most remote corners of the world gather to determine who among them will be able to wear the coveted Dark Choco Crown. In order to win, they will need a good sense of risk, a sprinkle of strategy, and a just a pinch of luck: are you ready to sit down at their table and prove what you're made of?
The most skilled master chocolatiers compete to wear the coveted Dark Choco Crown!

In order to win, one needs strategy, luck, and to know when to take risks.


Draw cards from your own deck. Be careful not to Bust!
Use them to buy exquisite Ingredients to add to your deck.
Score bonus points by conquering precious Desserts!

boardgame.name: The Screaming Wall of Tiberius
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Screaming Wall of Tiberius is a gigantic structure made of ancient screaming monoliths left being by the Titans of old, that now block the entrance to the lair of the euponymous Tiberius, an enigmatic deaf snake.

boardgame.name: Clown Ring Toss
boardgame.description: A clown figure is attached to a game board by means of a brass tube. Players take turns throwing rope rings from ten feet away. For every successful throw or "Ringer", 25 points is scored. The player with the highest score after ten turns wins. Alternatively, players can play to an agreed-upon score to win the game.

boardgame.name: A Long Way from Lilliput
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Lilliputian airship Sky Pig has crash-landed, brought down by Llortle, a foul-natured and territorial magpie.

Tensions are high amongst the surviving crew. They are injured, hungry and on the verge of mutiny.

Will the mice help to ease tensions among the mutinous crew, or will they exacerbate them? Will they uncover Captain Wulfert's secret mission? Will they befriend Llortle, or will they steal her treasure? Play to find out.

Inside you'll find:

- Stats for the mutinous crew of tiny men, and the terrifying magpie that stalks them
- A map of the ruined Sky Pig
- Rules for firearms, a new weapon class

boardgame.name: The Murderous Monks of the Mournful Moor
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This is a short (designed to be played in fewer than 3 hours) dungeon crawl/adventure for MÖRK BORG. It features wrongful imprisonment, viciously fanatic monks, and a terrible color-consuming demon.

boardgame.name: The Farm Card
boardgame.description:
The Farm Card is an RPG Farming Mini-Game for the Pleasure-not-Business Card RPG Jam. It's a simple, quick, and tiny set of instructions for running a small farm in any typical fantasy setting.

- Quirky roleplaying opportunities that will make you ask, "Why did this have to happen to my farm?!"
- Fits on a business card - we mean it when we say it's a mini-game
- Encourages group discussions & creative problem solving
- It's fast - convenient for on-the-spot downtime activity generation, or to just pass the time!

boardgame.name: Bolo Santizeli's Prosthetics
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Tired of having just a hook for a hand? Keep dropping your mugs?

How about instead you crush them with an iron fist!

Smallwolf Collective presents 7 new alternatives for when your meat hook gets lost to explosives, ghouls and other dungeon hazards! From the simple mace hand to the Hand of Nechrubel, an artifact that can kill the world in a week.

boardgame.name: The Silence
boardgame.description: This is an adventure for first-level characters. Contained in this document are seven horrifying low-level monsters, as well as the framework for a world in which these ghosts exist. I designed these ghosts to create more narrative nuance for low-level adventures, and to create a greater sense of horror in my 5E adventures.

boardgame.name: Border States
boardgame.description:
1861. Civil erupts across America. Abraham Lincoln and Jefferson Davis vie for control of the nation’s destiny, with both understanding that the struggle is as much political as it is a process of arms. Victory in battle will provide the most persuasive political argument when it comes to the five slave states bordering those already in contention – Delaware, Kentucky, Maryland, Missouri, and West Virginia. These are the states both the Confederacy and the Union need to win over. In each case, how these scales will tip, favoring either abolition or those who endorse the doctrine of human “property,” is yet to be decided. Battle and politics will sway the balance, and the result will help tell the story of this bloody war.

Border States is a tactical game for 2 players, with each player taking control of one side. Your aim is to win the sort of decisive victories that will influence the Border States and rally them to your cause. Effective bluff, and at the same time being able to discern your enemy’s intentions, will be your best assets. Playing time is about 45 minutes.

There are two ways to win the game: control sufficient States tokens to win by sudden death, or be the player with the most victory points at the end of the 5 rounds.

boardgame.name: High Noon: Bloodcreek Bushwhackers
boardgame.description:
Remnants of a lost cause. Survivors of a massacre. For a country that abandoned them, the war is over. For this band of men, it has just begun. Left for dead and deserted by their homeland, these survivors of the Blood Creek Massacre have only vengeance as their refuge, stalking their oppressors in the dead of night, becoming themselves the haunting specters of Saratoga and they will not rest until the men who murdered their brothers join them in Hell!

The Blood Creek Bushwhackers posse is one of sabotage and ambush. What they lack in range, they make up for in surprise. When the Bushwhackers are on the table, no space is safe and no loot crate is secure as these gray ghosts can pop up anywhere to attack an unsuspecting target or detonate crates, destroying them entirely and dealing damage to all around them!

This expansion posse includes
4 Miniatures (1 x Maj. Mosby, 3 x Bushwhacker)
1 Starting tile (6 x 10 inch Town Entrance)
34 Posse cards (2.5 x 3.5 inch playing cards)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: High Noon

boardgame.name: High Noon: The Jenkins Brothers
boardgame.description:
Deep in the swamps of Pascagoula County sits a small barrel town of moonshiners founded by the Jenkins family. After the Governor’s violent crackdown of the industry left most of the family dead, the last surviving patriarch has gathered his kin and – with nothing left to lose - takes the fight straight city hall. But this will be no peaceful protest.

The Jenkins Brothers are a trio of close range punishment. Two of the brothers, Jethro and Jonah, brandish powerful shotguns that execute carnage through cover and doors, while the giant Clifton’s brutish strength and combo attacks sends his opponents flying in every direction.

This expansion posse includes:
3 Miniatures (1 x Jethro Jenkins, 1 x Jonah Jenkins, 1 x Clifton Jenkins)
1 Starting tile (6 x 6 inch General Store Tile)
36 Posse cards (2.5 inch x 3.5 inch playing cards)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: High Noon

boardgame.name: High Noon: Monco and McAtte
boardgame.description:
A retired colonel, hunting the man who murdered his lover, teams up with a gunslinging stranger with no name to form one of the deadliest bounty-hunting posses Saratoga has ever seen. One is quick on the draw, the other has the range of a marksman. Together, they hunt the notorious outlaws of the West, cleaning the streets and filling their pockets.

Monco & McAtte are a dynamic duo that work better together than apart, but can stand on their own if they have to.

This expansion posse includes:
2 Miniatures (1 x Davis McAtte, 1 x Joe Monco)
1 Starting tile (6 x 6 inch Gunsmith Tile)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: High Noon

boardgame.name: Conquête des pôles
boardgame.description:
This game was edited with the help of scientist Paul-Emile Victor.
The game has two phases.
1. The preparatory cours.
During the preparatory course, the players will gather the equipment necessary for their expedition. Each player rolls the dice and advances his pawn on the dedicated course by following the arrows. He earns material tokens he will need for his expedition and places them on his route plan.
2.The expeditions.
We mix the "panoramas", "jokers" and "stop" cards. each player draws 8 cards at random. The rest is the pickaxe. Each player will then seek to obtain the 8 panorama cards of his expedition by asking for them from his opponents or by iterating them in the deck. Progress is indicated in pencil on the route plan. During the game, players will have to answer general knowledge questions about the poles and thus earn points. The player who completes his expedition first earns 500 bonus points.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Hit Parade
boardgame.description:
Hit parade is a game based on the same spirit as the monopoly one.

The player must collect 4 "Gold disc" from different artist to win the game. To do that they will throw the dice and move their pawn on the board to buy artist cards.

Once a player as an artist card, he should develop them to get higher in the artist ranking until winning a Gold disc.

When an artist card is already taken by a player, an other player can challenge him: the players write on a piece of paper an amount of money. If the one who challenged the card wins, he should take the card and pay the difference between the two amounts to the bank. If the one who was challenged wins, he keeps his card and the other player must pay him the difference between the two amounts. If the amount are equal, nothing happens.

The player can lose or win money all along the play depending of the boxes they go in (taxes, royalties, bank) and they can sell artists of disc gold to get money back.

boardgame.name: High Noon: The Abernathy Gang
boardgame.description:
When those deputized to enforce justice only sought to twist and corrupt it to their own ends, this Man of Metal and his bushranging renegades took the law into their own hands. But when everyone has their own ideas of order, the compass tends to tailspin into chaos, and that’s precisely what transpired at the Bloodbath of Brunswany, where the unstoppable, armored Nelson Abernathy and his Abernathy Gang went down in infamy as ruthless outlaws with a thirst for violence.

The Abernathy Gang are heavy hitting gunfighters, that can take just as much punishment as they can give. Using torches, the gang can light entire buildings ablaze while Nelson’s impenetrable metal plating absorbs his enemies’ attacks for days and the sight of a brass star brings out a monster in Nelson that has become the nursery rhyme for misbehaving children across the country.

This expansion posse includes:
3 Miniatures (1 x Nelson Abernathy, 2 x Bushranger)
1 Starting tile (6 x 6 inch Blacksmith Tile)
36 Posse cards (2.5 inch x 3.5 inch playing cards)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: High Noon

boardgame.name: Jeu des étoiles
boardgame.description:
The principle of the game is simple: the players must move from one star to another by the simplest and shortest possible way. Players advance along the constellations, depending on the result of a 12-sided die. If players need to move from one constellation to another, they use a ruler to gauge the distances.
For each journey completed, the players earn points. Whoever has the most wins.

boardgame.name: Stigmergy
boardgame.description:
Stigmergy is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

Two stones, or a stone and an empty cell, see each other if they lie on the same straight line of adjacent cells and there are no other stones between them along that line. You control a cell if the number of stones of your color it sees is more than half the number of cells (empty or occupied) adjacent to it. To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of the following actions: a) Pass, provided that there are no empty cells or every empty cell is controlled by some player. b) Place a stone of your color on an empty cell not controlled by your opponent. c) Flip an enemy stone on a cell you control. The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the number of stones of your color on the board, plus the number of empty cells you control, plus komi in the case of White. The button is used to avoid ties.

Komi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as compensation for going second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games. The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. It is only used when komi is an odd number. On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button.

Stigmergy is based on Michał Zapała's Tumbleweed.

boardgame.name: Crime Time
boardgame.description:
From Book Interior



What Do We Need?

You are going to need some supplies for this game. First, you’ll need envelopes, stamps, and some blank playing cards or slips of paper of uniform size. You’ll be writing and drawing on those cards, so grab pens, markers, crayons, whatever you want to use.

That’s pretty much everything. You may want scraps of paper for taking notes later on in the game, but you aren’t required to take notes (I’m not your teacher, and this isn’t a class).



Wait, What is This Game?

Oh right, the pitch! This is a tabletop RPG that takes place over three phases. During the first phase, you all will be mailing each other a stack of blank playing cards, writing and drawing on them to set up heist. After that, phase two begins with you shuffling up those cards, and building the perfect heist. You’ll set the stage, decide what the crime is, and introduce the crew. Finally, during the optional phase 3, you’ll try and pull off the job, narrating and
acting out scenes as a table.

In short, this is an RPG that uses mail, drawing, and
collaborative storytelling to do crime.

boardgame.name: Carentan, 10-13th June 1944
boardgame.description:
The game Carentan, 10 - 13th June 1944 shows fierce fighting in Normandy between Germans and Americans. In starting phase of the battle enemy armies used elite airborne formations and later less experienced mechanized forces. In effect training and determination factors were balanced. Americans achieved success because of material advantage and better coordination of combined arms actions.
Could the battle outcome have been different? On tactical level German fallschirmjägers had edge, because they were masters in using urban terrain. But lack of ammo and high casualties forced them to leave Carentan. On the other hand Americans used consistently artillery support and they gained ground step by step. These battlefield elements are shown in "Great Battles of Small Units" system.
Two scenarios are included.
"Purple Heart Lane" depicts struggle for Carentan between enemy paratroopers. Players can use optional rule and see what would be battle finale, if troops from 17th SS Panzergrenadier Division appeared earlier on the battlefield.
The scenario "Battle of Bloody Gulch" shows American defence of Carentan against German counterattack. In this fighting American armored units are present as well.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Great battles of Small Units (Strategemata)

boardgame.name: Cheddar Off Dead
boardgame.description:
Sigil is full of a multitude of creeds, religions, factions and wanderers.

It also happens to have the best damn cheesemongers in all the multiverse.

Chant has it the Dustmen have just opened a new cheese house called Cheddar Off Dead and it is the rage of the Hive. It takes a skilled cutter to make off with the best product in Sigil. Who better to take up the cross-trade than the creatures created to spy by the Illithid?

That’s right, berk, you’re a goddamn cranium rat, and you’re about to bob the Dusties.

boardgame.name: Unincorporated
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A GMless story game about small-town drama. Play ordinary people caught up in petty dramas, long-held grudges, intense friendships, and hopeless love affairs, all while trying to shake off the weight of expectations.

It’s designed to be played in 1-5 sessions, with no prep and a quick, easy setup. Gameplay uses PbtA-style 2d6 +stat dice rolls. Your stats are Jock, Nerd, Prep, and Goth. You can change your dice results or your reputation -- or even add a new stat -- by spending tokens, which you earn by choosing to fail or add complications.

boardgame.name: Weird Little Town
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Weird Little Town is an alternate setting playbook for Unincorporated, inspired by Welcome to Night Vale, Hot Fuzz, The Wicker Man, and other stories of towns with dark secrets and bizarre conspiracies barely concealed from the hapless outsiders who stumble into them.

boardgame.name: Stuck in Jawbone
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It's time to uncover the dark secrets hidden beneath Jawbone's less-than-pristine snow. Get embroiled in local dramas. Hunt monsters in the sewer. Take up the retired swordsman's challenge to a duel. Help that nice young mage find their lost brother. Go see the ghost who appears in the graveyard every night. Or grab your silver bullets and wooden stakes and head on out to the haunted temple.
The Module

Stuck in Jawbone is an adventure for use with Dungeon World, but should be easy to adapt to your OSR system of choice. It can be played as a campaign starter or a 3 to 5-session self-contained adventure. The central mystery has several possible entry points and intertwined paths that provide interesting challenges for all playbooks. It's about as close as you can get to being a mystery sandbox. There's plenty to do, and splitting the party is highly recommended.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: GWASL VI – Blood on the Isonzo: Italian WW1
boardgame.description:
Italy upended their Central Powers allies by entering the war on the side of the Allies in May of 1915, following secret negotiations. Italy fought mostly against Austria-Hungary along the northern border, including high up in the now-Italian Alps and along the Isonzo river. The war was initially a failure for Italy despite being numerically superior to Austria-Hungary. The Italian army repeatedly attacked Austria, making little progress and suffering heavy losses, and then being routed in 1917 by a German-Austrian counteroffensive after Russia left the war allowing the Central Powers to move reinforcements to the Italian Front from the Eastern Front. In October 1918, as civil unrest increased in Austria-Hungary, the Italians attacked again. The Austrian army broke, and the Italians drove deep into Austrian territory. Fighting ended on 3 November 1918.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Hill 383 - Plava, Italy, June 20th 1915
City of Violets - Gorizia, Italy, May 5h 1915
First Rush - Podgorica, Italy, July 2nd 1915
Isonzo Marsch - Tolmino, Italy, September 10th 1917
Tolmino Bridgehead - Tolmino, Italy, September 12th 1917
Cappuccio Wood - Mount San Michele, Italy, July 25th 1915
Vrtojba - Vrtojba, Italy, November 4th 1916
On To Monte Majur - Monte Majur, Italy, October 25th 1917

boardgame.name: Meridians
boardgame.description:
Meridians is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. It has a territorial nature, but the goal is to annihilate opponent's stones.

"Meridians" is named after the meridians system.

COMPONENT
A centerless hexagonal board tessellated with triangles (any size. The regular size board has 6 points to 2 sides and 7 points to 4 sides)
Sufficient stones of 2 colors

DEFINITIONS
Group: like-colored stones adjacent to each other. Singletons are considered groups of size 1.
Path: an empty point, or an uninterrupted straight line of empty points that have a pair of like-colored stones on both ends, which are not part of the same group. Such a pair is said to have a path.
Dead group: a group in which all stones belonging to it have no path. If any stone belonging to a group has a path, the group is said to have a path.

GAME PLAY (Overview)
Decide which player plays as which color (Light or Dark) in any adequate way.
Light goes first, then alternate turns.
On each player's first turn, players place a stone of their own color on any empty point.
On each player's second turn, players place another stone of their color so that their own two stones have a path.

Then players take actions below on each turn, in this order.
1. Remove all opponent’s dead groups.
2. Place a stone of their own color on an empty point that is on at least one same straight line with an existing friendly stone, and no opponent's stone in between. Passing is not allowed.

After the second turn, the player with no stones of their color on the board at the beginning of their turn loses.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Cards Christians Like
boardgame.description:
Cards Christians Like is a party game but with convictions. Each round, one player will read a prompt (blue card) for other players to fill in with their funniest response (white card).

The first player to win seven blue cards wins the game.

The cards are unique observations about church and culture that play in hundreds of hilarious combinations.

boardgame.name: Carnegie: Deluxe Metal Goods Cubes
boardgame.description:
Enhance your copy of Carnegie Deluxe with this set of 40 stunning metal Goods Cubes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: GWASL VII – Soldiers of the Sultan: Turkish WW1
boardgame.description:
The soldiers of the Ottoman Empire fought a variety of combatants during World War I.
There were five main campaigns in the theatre: the Sinai and Palestine Campaign, the Mesopotamian Campaign, the Caucasus Campaign, the Persian Campaign, and most famously, the Gallipoli Campaign.
The Ottomans joined the Central Powers, goaded by Germany, in its hope that Russian troops would be drained away from the fronts in Galicia and Poland. Scenarios in this module cover the Battle of Sarikamish, as well as the campaigns in Mesopotamia, Palestine, and OF COURSE … Gallippoli, one of the most disastrous campaigns of the Conflict.
The Dardanelles campaign was fought on Turkish soil, as the ANZAC tried to create a passage through to the Black Sea. Gallipoli was the brainchild of Winston Churchill, and was a bitter failure. After massive hardship, ANZAC soldiers were withdrawn, having failed in most cases to even get off the beaches. Russia also invaded Turkish territory, in the north. Following the collapse of the Tsar’s government, the Turks swept north and entered Russian territory proper. By the Russian surrender in the Spring of 1918, the Turkish forces had taken Baku on the Caspian Sea.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

The Bergmann Offensive - Caucasus Front, November 7th 1914
Stand At Pine Ridge - Pine Ridge, Gallipoli Peninsula, April 25th 1915
Plugge's Point - Z Beach, Geba Tabe, Gallipoli Peninsula, April 25th 1915
Valley Of Death - Kereves Dere, Gallipoli Peninsula, June 21st 1915
Forgotten Arabs - Gallipoli Peninsula, August 6th 1915
Achi Baba Nulla - Cape Helles, Gallipoli Peninsula, June 4th 1915
Fir Tree Spur - Cape Helles, Gallipoli Peninsula, May 8th 1915
Australian Achilles - Gallipoli Peninsula, May 19th 1915

boardgame.name: Papertrail
boardgame.description: Players take turns rolling a dice and placing paper trails in the form of white counters on the spaces allocated on the game board. After all 48 tiles have been laid, players then take turns moving their pawns and collecting the counters either using forward movement or a combination of forward and backward movement, the sum of which must equal to the dice roll. When all players have completed the circuit, the game ends and the winner is the player with the most counters collected.

boardgame.name: Mage Against The Machine
boardgame.description:
In Mage Against The Machine you take on the roll of time-travelling wizards attempting to stop the robot apocalypse. You will travel back to the moments in your lives you have the most connection to in the hopes of finding the events that set in motion the destruction of civilization. But meddling with reality comes at a cost. Each time you use your magic to alter the world you generate anomalies, push too hard and the things you care about most may no longer exist in the present.

Players will create their character by giving them a defining memory they are able to travel back to. Unlike many other games, Mage Against The Machine doesn't use a GM. Instead the player whose moment it is fills in all the details; this player is also unable to take any direct action to alter the timeline or risk catastrophic destruction. Each player will get a chance to take on the role of answering the other players' questions as you visit that moment.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Pirates Gold
boardgame.description: Players race through a track peppered with skull and crossbones spaces and treasure chest spaces. If a player lands on a skull and crossbones space, he/she takes a skull and crossbones card and go back X - Y spaces. If a player lands on a treasure chest space, he/she takes a treasure chest card and move forward X + Y spaces. The values of X and Y are given on each card.

boardgame.name: Exit, Pursued by a Bear
boardgame.description:
You are Leonardo DiCaprio or another non-bear humanoid just going about your day when a goddamn bear appears and tries to eat you.

Don't let it eat you.

Take turns telling your friends exactly how the bear tries to eat them and then listen to them try to desperately avoid getting eaten. Then let the Jenga tower decide what happens.

That's it. That's the whole game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Exit, Pursued by a Bear (Kid Friendly Version)
boardgame.description:
You are Leonardo DiCaprio or another non-bear humanoid just going about your day when a goddamn bear appears and tries to eat you.

Don't let it eat you.

Take turns telling your friends exactly how the bear tries to eat them and then listen to them try to desperately avoid getting eaten. Then let the Jenga tower decide what happens.

That's it. That's the whole game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: DON'T DIE
boardgame.description:
DON'T DIE is a role-playing game inspired by many classic horror films: Halloween, Friday the 13th, Sleepaway Camp. But most of all, it's inspired by Scream. See, in a horror flick, there are rules that the young folks need to follow. Rules of morality, sensibility, conduct, and irony.

Don't drink. Don't smoke. Don't say "I'll be right back!"


Break a rule, and you find yourself in the hungry eyes of a killer. Will you survive the encounter? Well, that's all up to fate.

In DON'T DIE, you and your friends are young people at a house party. You know each other, somehow, and while you might not be friends, you'll get to know each other better tonight. Why? Well, there's a dead body in the garage, and somebody said they saw something moving in the trees outside. You're all in danger, now. The killer is coming for you.

Each of you will hold a few secret cards in your hand. These correlate to rules for character's behavior, a chart of which everyone knows. On your turn, you describe how your character risks their neck to survive the killer, by pushing the boundaries of the publicly known rules. If a rule they push is one held by another player, that player reveals that card, and narrates how the killer comes after the potential victim. They narrate their escape attempt, and draw a card. That card will decide whether they survive, or wind up dead.

As party, you need to make those risky moves to make it to morning. As people die, you need less to make it. If you've risked enough after a character is killed, the rest of you survive. If the last of you is cut down before you've risked enough, the killer has won the night.

Let's see if you can watch the sunrise.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Starship: A Vessel RPG
boardgame.description: In STARSHIP, you and your friends take on the mantle of the crew of your own space-faring VESSEL. You decide the nature, power, and features of your ship, and you also work together to create the factions and powers in your world. Once built, you’re set loose to explore, take missions, and survive in the vast void. What will you do, who will you work for, and what will you give to make a living in the deep, dark sky?

boardgame.name: War Rig: A Vessel RPG
boardgame.description:
In WAR RIG, you and your friends ride atop a mighty machine of metal and fuel. The wheels on which you live carry you from settlement to settlement, searching for supplies and scrap in the wasteland to scrape out a living. But the world is full of many threats. You must rely on each other to survive in the world, but you must also know how to conserve your resources for the good of the group (or, maybe, your own). The world will grind you down, but hope brings you and yours to the next dawn. Hold on to it.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Mombasa: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
Mombasa is a heavy euro from the famous designer Alexander Pfister. With this organizer, you can set up more efficiently and start trading in Africa in no time!

Features

supports premium sleeved cards
unique house holders for quick setup
engraved first player marker
separate player trays
resource tray with acrylic lid.

boardgame.name: Land Rush: A Game of Of-Fence and De-Fence
boardgame.description:
Land Rush is played with Chess pieces on a Chess board, and for the most part the pieces have their normal Chess moves. (Pawn movement is slightly different.) However, other than kings pieces cannot capture, and the goal of the game is to build a connected chain of your pieces between the left and right edges of the board which fences off more than 32 squares.

The board starts empty. On a turn a player may create a piece or move an existing piece. Pieces are created on the owner's first rank and have point values: in order to create a piece there must be at least as many pieces in its file as its point value. (Pawns have a value of 0 so can be created at the start of the game.)

boardgame.name: Longship: A Vessel RPG
boardgame.description:
LONGSHIP is a tabletop roleplaying game where you and your friends embark on a journey across the vast expanse upon your mighty LONGSHIP. Meddling gods, and the magicks of ancient artifacts will guide your path. Along the way, you will be tested, and the bond between you will be the very thing that keeps you afloat.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Shipwrights of the North Sea: Laserox Organizer
Shipwrights of the North Sea: Viking Shipwright's Organizer
boardgame.description:
Building ships is no easy task, you need skilled craftsman to do the hard work. In Shipwrights of the North Sea, the first game in the North Sea Saga, you lead a small viking town preparing for the big raids which are coming next summer. To keep all your tools and resources organized use our Viking Organizer.

Features:

fits premium sleeved cards
fits base game and expansion
two trays for resources
quick and easy setup
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Shipwrights of the North Sea (Second Edition)
Shipwrights of the North Sea: The Townsfolk Expansion

listing.notes: Title: Laserox Viking Shipwright's Organizer Publisher: Laserox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Be the Tree
boardgame.description:
User Summery
A Solo Journaling Game About Observing Trees.

boardgame.name: Don't Cut The Tree
boardgame.description:
User Summery
A Solo Journaling Game About Observing Trees.

boardgame.name: Roll for the Galaxy: Laserox Organizer
Roll for the Galaxy: Stardust Storage
boardgame.description:
You have all the dice flying around in your box? Get our Stardust Storage for Roll for the Galaxy™ to keep all things neatly organized! Store the dice in the dice container, with easy to use overlays. This organizer will support the base game and the Galaxy: Ambition expansion.

Features

2 removable trays for dice, tokens and victory points
section for the cups
enough place to store all the tiles
a starting player token in form of a space ship and a special cube for the winner of the game
5 acrylic overlays


Supports the following

Roll for the Galaxy
Roll for the Galaxy: Ambition

listing.notes: Title: Laserox Roll for the Galaxy Storage Publisher: Laserox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Rising Sun: Laserox Organizer
Rising Sun: Shogun's Stash Organizer
boardgame.description:
Ready to dive into the feudal Japan and fight your battle with Daimyos, Bushis and Shintos? This organizer will definitely help you getting your troops ready and organized. We designed it for an easy and quick setup and clean up after game. The rotating box, which is a unique and new solution will help you also during game to store and have easy access to the coins and Ronin tokens.
The box lid will sit flush with the insert inside. The clan trays are interchangable if you own our Daimyo Box insert and have the other three clans as well.

Features
separate tray for each clan, with an engraving on the front for quick identification
two trays for the big monsters, which have their names engraved
a tray for the cards, divided by seasons (supports sleeved cards)
unique rotating tower tray for the mandate tiles, war numbers, coins and ronin tokens
supports the Kickstarter exclusive upgraded components
plastic clips to ensure a good grip on the miniature bases

boardgame.name: Wizwords!: The Ultimate Crossword Game
boardgame.description:
In Wizwords! one or more players gradually build up a crossword grid as the game progresses. (The box says "1+" but six seems like a reasonable maximum number of players.)

On a turn a player draws a letter card and adds a word containing that letter to the grid, connected it to existing words as in Scrabble.

The grid starts with no black squares; after the first turn a player's turn starts by covering letters in previous words with black tiles to leave shorter words, or incomplete words which they complete on their turn.

boardgame.name: Zypher: The Scrambled Word Game
boardgame.description:
In Zypher players race to the end of a track by unscrambling anagrams in 30 seconds.

A player may choose to unscramble a five-letter anagram for a small benefit (e.g. advancing one's own piece or moving an opponent's back), or a six-letter anagram for a larger benefit (e.g. both moving your own piece forwards and another back).

boardgame.name: Suit Up!: Strings
boardgame.description:
Strings (one of two games in a article titled Suit Up!) is a no-luck card game.

Each player gets the 13 cards of a suit from a standard deck of cards, and takes turn playing one card at a time to a set of "strings" on the table. A "string" is a row of cards in ascending sequence with no gaps, e.g. a 4 must be followed by a 5, then a 6, etc.

A string can be started with any card except an ace, 10, or a court card; the latter are wild.

There is a limit of seven strings with three players and nine with four, which may make it impossible for a player to play later in the game, in which case they discard a card.

When all cards are gone players assess each string to see who wins it: 2-10 count their face values, aces count 11, and court cards count 5. The winner takes the string; if there is a tie the cards are split evenly. The player winning the most cards wins the game.

Several variants are provided.
